page.title: 12St Mary's Church
page.content: The present church (Vicar,{Reverend {M.Brotherton)}was designed in 1889 by Bloomfield. Two earlier churches had existed on the site. Notable features include 8 bells in a 150 foot tower, a heavy brass lectern in the shape of an eagle, a statue of the Virgin Mary and baby Jesus and a marble font with carved biblical scenes. {Isambard Kingdom Brunel}and{Charles {Dickens}were baptised here. A bomb shattered all the stained glass in the east window in World War II, except for the window of Christ. About 400 people attend services. The needs of scouts, guides, the deaf, old people and battered wives are catered for. Once, two boys got stuck in the under floor heating system but were eventually rescued. This vast church could have been{Portsmouth Cathedral. -Form 3H: Penhale Middle School
